member.summary: Default flags settings These are the following values: , and

member.summary: No options are set.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CredentialsDialogOptions.IncorrectPassword
member.summary: Notify the user of insufficient credentials by displaying the "Logon unsuccessful" balloon tip.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CredentialsDialogOptions.DoNotPersist
member.summary: Do not store credentials or display check boxes. You can pass ShowSaveCheckBox with this newDS to display the Save check box only, and the result is returned in the property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CredentialsDialogOptions.RequestAdministrator
member.summary: Populate the combo box with local administrators only.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CredentialsDialogOptions.ExcludeCertificates
member.summary: Populate the combo box with user name/password only. Do not display certificates or smart cards in the combo box.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CredentialsDialogOptions.RequireCertificate
member.summary: Populate the combo box with certificates and smart cards only. Do not allow a user name to be entered.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CredentialsDialogOptions.ShowSaveCheckBox
member.summary: If the check box is selected, show the Save check box and return true in the property, otherwise, return false. Check box uses the value in the property by default.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CredentialsDialogOptions.AlwaysShowUI
member.summary: Specifies that a user interface will be shown even if the credentials can be returned from an existing credential in credential manager. This newDS is permitted only if GenericCredentials is also specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CredentialsDialogOptions.RequireSmartcard
member.summary: Populate the combo box with certificates or smart cards only. Do not allow a user name to be entered.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CredentialsDialogOptions.Persist
member.summary: Do not show the Save check box, but the credential is saved as though the box were shown and selected.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CredentialsDialogOptions.ServerCredential
member.summary: This newDS is meaningful only in locating a matching credential to pre-fill the dialog box, should authentication fail. When this newDS is specified, wildcard credentials will not be matched. It has no effect when writing a credential. CredUI does not create credentials that contain wildcard characters. Any found were either created explicitly by the user or created programmatically, as happens when a RAS connection is made.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CredentialsDialogOptions.ExpectConfirmation
member.summary: Specifies that the caller will call ConfirmCredentials after checking to determine whether the returned credentials are actually valid. This mechanism ensures that credentials that are not valid are not saved to the credential manager. Specify this newDS in all cases unless DoNotPersist is specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CredentialsDialogOptions.GenericCredentials
member.summary: Consider the credentials entered by the user to be generic credentials, rather than windows credentials.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CredentialsDialogOptions.UsernameTargetCredentials
member.summary: The credential is a "RunAs" credential. The TargetName parameter specifies the name of the command or program being run. It is used for prompting purposes only.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.WindowsCredentialsDialogOptions.None
member.summary: No options are set.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.WindowsCredentialsDialogOptions.Generic
member.summary: The caller is requesting that the credential provider return the user name and password in plain text. This value cannot be combined with SecurePrompt.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.WindowsCredentialsDialogOptions.ShowSaveCheckBox
member.summary: The Save check box is displayed in the dialog box.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.WindowsCredentialsDialogOptions.AuthPackageOnly
member.summary: Only credential providers that support the authentication package specified by the authPackage parameter should be enumerated. This value cannot be combined with InAuthBufferCredentialsOnly.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.WindowsCredentialsDialogOptions.InAuthBufferCredentialsOnly
member.summary: Only the credentials specified by the InAuthBuffer parameter for the authentication package specified by the authPackage parameter should be enumerated. If this flag is set, and the InAuthBuffer parameter is NULL, the function fails. This value cannot be combined with AuthPackageOnly.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.WindowsCredentialsDialogOptions.EnumerateOnlyAdministrators
member.summary: Credential providers should enumerate only administrators. This value is intended for User Account Control (UAC) purposes only. We recommend that external callers not set this flag.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.WindowsCredentialsDialogOptions.EnumerateCurrentUser
member.summary: Only the incoming credentials for the authentication package specified by the authPackage parameter should be enumerated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.WindowsCredentialsDialogOptions.SecurePrompt
member.summary: The credential dialog box should be displayed on the secure desktop. This value cannot be combined with Generic. Windows Vista: This value is not supported until Windows Vista with SP1.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.WindowsCredentialsDialogOptions.Pack32WOW
member.summary: The credential provider should align the credential BLOB pointed to by the refOutAuthBuffer parameter to a 32-bit boundary, even if the provider is running on a 64-bit system.
